intro: Gaertnera ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf gaertnera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves that are often pubescent on the underside. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Gaertnera ovata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
